DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , non-randomized , observational , multicenter study urethral length measure woman surgically-correctable stress urinary incontinence undergo suburethral sling operative procedure .
DOC.brief_title: Urethral Length Measurement Women Undergoing Suburethral Sling Operative Procedure
DOC.detailed_description: This prospective , non-randomized , observational , multicenter study urethral length measure woman surgically-correctable stress urinary incontinence undergo suburethral sling operative procedure . Data collect preoperative urogynecological test medical history . The urethral length measure intraoperatively use scale catheter . Outcome data , include development postoperative complication , collect several time interval .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patient objective , demonstrable sign stress urinary incontinence ( SUI ) , include patient intrinsic sphincter deficiency ( ISD ) . Objective test include : standing stress test , urodynamics evaluation pad test . 2 . Patient age 18 old . 3 . Patient agree participate study , include completion studyrelated procedure evaluation , document agreement sign Institutional Review Board/Ethics Committeeapproved inform consent form . 4 . Patient able fill questionnaire ( base judgment investigator ) 1 . Patient associate suspected neurological disease . 2 . Patient active lesion present injury perineum urethra . 3 . Patient urethral obstruction . 4 . Patient significant pelvic organ prolapse ( Grade III/IV ) require surgical treatment . 5 . Patient current urinary tract infection .
